text: good good morning everyone uh my name is
Zach I'm the uh lead maintainer for Aro
rollouts um and so I'm going to give you
a quick update about that uh first as
first is the just non- maintainer
contributor growth of AR rollet has been
pretty great this graph is basically uh
over the last five years per quarter uh
the number of non-contributor
contributions um we have a pretty good
growth in both
the pure number and the uh number of
unique individual contributors which is
pretty great to see um so let's keep
that uh path continually growing and get
out there and open open issues fix bugs
everyone in the audience can do that
feel free to reach out um to me the
community and and just get
involved uh a couple of new features for
our good roll outs um over the last
couple years we've kind of uh gone
through a plug-in transition um we've
worked on adding um analysis uh run
plugins and traffic router plugins uh
and kind of the last uh step of that
would be step plugins so uh one of the
kind of the main motivators for this was
once we have traffic router plugins
people uh traffic routers have very
unique feature sets and you might want
to have a specific plug-in that only
works for your traffic router whether
it's it's being able to do multi- region
traffic shifting before doing a
deployment and then failing back over or
just a you know path-based uh routing
and switching back it let it lets uh
basically the traffic router plugin have
very unique steps um for its specific
thing and then there's various other
things you can do with it such as like
syncing multiple roll outs people have
kind of contributed various ideas for
this um this is a pretty new feature so
if anyone is interested in getting a
plugin out there um we can put that
under Aro Pro labs and you guys can
basically become one of your own
maintainers uh
yeah uh the other um interesting new
feature is we've spent some work on our
UI um within the Argo rollouts UI when
you view analysis analysis runs which is
basically Argo roll out's way to query
um various metric providers to determine
whether or not to abort the roll out
we've now added nice UI support so
people can click that little button
under that's red Circle there and get
basically a popup that shows them a
graph and a dashboard uh a table of all
the metrics that are configured um and
why their analysis basically failed
without having to dig in through a bunch
of yaml and things like that so it's
kind of a nice
addition um we've also spent a bit of
work on analysis runs
again uh Argo rollouts has a mode of
operation where you can run the
controller and basically analysis run
only mode uh various projects use this I
think think cargo and I think Numa is
may be considering to use this as well
basically they want to piggyback off of
Argo roll outs' analysis and all the
providers that they provide for
metrics um and so part of that was uh
just being able to run the controller in
that mode for efficiencies uh we also
added TTL support to the analysis run
object because Argo roll outs used to
maintain the life cycle of analysis runs
and as uh if you it lets people just
basically create analysis run configure
a a life cycle within the analysis run
so no other controller has to manage
that life cycle
basically uh analysis templates within
analysis templates that gives uh admins
of Argo roll outs ways to basically do
more separations of concerns so an admin
can create like a library of templates
that service teams can then subscribe to
um which is a great feature to have and
last but not least we let analysis runs
now are supported as data for um the
notification engine so when you want to
send a notification uh about your roll
out you can include data from the
analysis run itself in
that last but not least the plug-in
Journey continues um uh codefresh has uh
been maintaining uh one of probably the
bigger plugins for roll outs which is
Gateway API support uh which means that
Argo roll outs now supports basically
any traffic router that is supported by
Gateway API um and that list is
obviously ever growing and getting
larger and larger um so feel free to uh
get out there and uh play with Gateway
API if you couldn't use roll outs before
because your traffic router didn't exist
um now you can
so that's it thank you
